definitions.definition: A stable system of two phases , one of which is dispersed in the other in the form of very small droplets or particles .

An intimate mixture of two substances , one of which, called the dispersed phase (or colloid ), is uniformly distributed in a finely divided state throughout the second substance, called the dispersion medium (or dispersing medium).
A particle less than 1 micron in diameter , following the Wentworth scale

main_definition: ( physical chemistry ) A stable system of two phases , one of which is dispersed in the other in the form of very small droplets or particles .
secondary_definitions: ( meteorology ) An intimate mixture of two substances , one of which, called the dispersed phase (or colloid ), is uniformly distributed in a finely divided state throughout the second substance, called the dispersion medium (or dispersing medium).
( geology ) A particle less than 1 micron in diameter , following the Wentworth scale
